Class FuelCell

java.lang.Object
  FuelCell

public class FuelCell
extends java.lang.Object

The fuelcell travels toward the space station when launched. It travels on a line horizontally from the apex of the shuttle.

Version:
September 2004, September 2005, revised by Carl Singer, September 2006, revised by Carl Singer
Author:
Carl Singer, Brian Howard, David Maharry

Constructor Summary
FuelCell(Canvas theCanvas, SpaceStation theSpaceStation)
          The constructor creates a fuel cell that can reference the space station and the shuttle.

          launch sets initial conditions for the launch.

Constructor Detail

FuelCell

public FuelCell(Canvas theCanvas,
                SpaceStation theSpaceStation)
The constructor creates a fuel cell that can reference the space station and the shuttle. It needs to know about these objects so it can coordinate docking operations for itself and for the shuttle.

Parameters:
theCanvas - the canvas to use for all graphics
theSpaceStation - the spaceStation - created by the Controller in this application
Method Detail

launch

public void launch(int xPosition,
                   int yPosition)
launch sets initial conditions for the launch.

moveSmallDistance

public void moveSmallDistance()
moveSmallDistance repeated calls to moveSmallDistance will move the fuel cell closer to its destination. Repeated calls to moveSmallDistance will eventually get the fuel cell close to the space station or off the right side of the canvas in case it missed the space station by to large of a distance.

status

public java.lang.String status()
status return the status of the cell

Returns:
status "refueled", 'missed", or "moving"
